Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cathlicicidin-PY analog2 C3D and C7X (synthetic AMPs20, UCSS1d)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (93.1%) toCathelicidin-PYK:21%; L:14%; R: 10%.Peptide engineering: the orginal disulfide bond between C3 and C7 has been replaced with a amide bond between the sidechains of D3 and X7 (2,4-diaminobutyric acid. Warning: represented with K in this sequence).Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (1 uM), P. aeruginosa SVB-B9 (MIC 8 uM) in MHB, S-aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC>64 uM), and C-albicans SC5314T (MIC >64 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: salt-sensitive; active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (4 uM), P. aeruginosa SVB-B9 (MIC 32 uM) in cation-adjusted MHB media.Structure: more helical than WT. Most helical in TFE in the series!
Literature Information.Author: Dissanayake S, He J, Yang SH, Brimble MA, Harris PWR, Cameron AJ. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Flow-Based Fmoc-SPPS Preparation and SAR Study of Cathelicidin-PY Reveals Selective Antimicrobial Activity.
